availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Veirs (Logan County, KY, farmer and postmaster)

body.p: Logan County, Kentucky, farmer and postmaster. Maryland native. Married to E. Veirs. Married to Catharine C Eubank Veirs in Logan County on February 7, 1848. Father of William Veirs, Henry Veirs, and Catharine Veirs. Farmer in Logan County in 1850. Farmer in Logan County in 1860. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in 1860. Postmaster of Black Lick post office, Auburn, Logan County, from June 5, 1861 to May 13, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Logan County Marriages, 1818-1919, Film #002134965, p. 1167 of microfilm.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 1, p. 423
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 1, pp. 20-21 of microfilm (377B and 378A stamped)
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, Auburn Corporation, p. 332A.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971. NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, NARA RG 28, Vol. 28, p. 378 of microfilm.
